reviewText: The film introduces the viewer to a number of aged survivors of the ethnic cleansing of Jerusalem 1948. Families who still live in the region recall the events of the catastrophic war that impacted every Palestinian family forever.  A few who were able return to their old neighborhoods and stand outside their homes recalling old memories of parents and siblings that took place and of the day they had to leave.  A powerful testament to those who continue to stand "outside their homeland" waiting for the "right to return" or to even see the ocean...65 years and counting.  We will never forget.
